alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 4:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Highway 89 near Cameron and Gray Mountain in Coconino County through 500 PM MST... At 436 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Gray Mountain, or 19 miles south of Tuba City, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gray Mountain and Cameron. This includes the following highways... State Route 64 between mile markers 289 and 295. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 454 and 470. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
